intro: Chlorocharis subprolifera, commonly known as the slender green alga, is a species of freshwater green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its filamentous thallus, which consists of unbranched, elongated cells that form dense, mat-like growths. The plant typically grows in shallow, nutrient-rich waters, such as ponds and lakes, where it can thrive in low light conditions. Its chloroplasts contain chlorophyll a and b, enabling it to perform photosynthesis efficiently. Chlorocharis subprolifera plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various aquatic organisms.
